1.rationale:
Let’s break down our current state:

• Our snake (ID 1) is at head position (6,3) with its only body segment at (6,2).
• Apples remain at (8,1), (5,6), (8,4), (3,8), and (2,2).
• The nearest apple by Manhattan distance is at (8,4). From our head at (6,3), the distance to (8,4) is |8 – 6| + |4 – 3| = 2 + 1 = 3.
• To approach (8,4), we could either move RIGHT (to (7,3)) or UP (to (6,4)):
  – RIGHT: New head (7,3) → then Manhattan distance to (8,4) becomes |8 – 7| + |4 – 3| = 1 + 1 = 2.
  – UP: New head (6,4) → then distance becomes |8 – 6| + |4 – 4| = 2 + 0 = 2.
• Both moves are safe (we don’t run into our own body, walls, or enemy snake).
• Considering flexibility, moving RIGHT to (7,3) not only leads us closer to (8,4) but may allow an easier setup to loop upward and then head to the apple without risk.

Thus, my strategy is to move RIGHT toward the promising apple at (8,4).

Decided next move: RIGHT.
